propertyGroup.name: Outlets
propertyGroup.documentation: Defines the locations to which output is generated.

property.name: services
property.documentation: The directory to which POJO service interfaces are generated.

property.name: service-impls
property.documentation: The directory to which POJO service implementation classes are generated

property.name: value-objects
property.documentation: The directory to which value objects are generated.

property.name: exceptions
property.documentation: The directory to which exceptions are generated.

property.name: enumerations
property.documentation: The directory to which enumerations are generated.

property.name: interfaces
property.documentation: The directory to which interfaces are generated.

property.name: interface-impls
property.documentation: The directory to which default interfaces implementations are generated.

property.name: generateRefFiles
property.documentation: Generates File.ref files if overwrite=false for a template output. Ref files contain what would have been generated to the original file if overwrite=true or if the file did not already exist. Can be used to replace or merge with the exiting file.

property.name: overwriteAll
property.documentation: Overwrite all files when generating output. Default=false. Use for project testing where all output will overwritten.

property.name: serializable
property.documentation: Indicates whether or not generated objects must support distributed environments. Adds SerialVersionUID to class, generated from combination of class/methods/parameters/types.

property.name: enablePropertyConstructors
property.documentation: Whether or not constructors taking all properties will be generated or not (on the value object for example).

property.name: interfaceImplementationNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern used to create the default interface implementation name, where {0} represents the name of the interface.

property.name: useArraysForMultiplicitiesOfTypeMany
property.documentation: Indicates whether or not to use Array [] instead of List for * multiplicity on ValueObject AssociationEnds.

property.name: XMLBindingAnnotations
property.documentation: Add XML to Java (Jaxb2) binding annotations to Value Object package/classes/methods.

property.name: enableTemplating
property.documentation: Indicates whether or not templated (strongly typed) Lists will be generated.

property.name: enableAnnotations
property.documentation: Indicates whether JDK5 annotations will be generated, i.e. @Override, @Deprecated.

property.name: xmlAttributes
property.documentation: If using XMLBindingAnnotations, annotate simple types as attributes instead of elements.

property.name: cxfVersion
property.documentation: If using XMLBindingAnnotations, output @XmlSeeAlso for Jaxb 2.1 support. Used in conjunction with webservices cartridge CXF implementation.

property.name: generateEqualPropertiesMethod
property.documentation: When set to 'true' the cartridge will generate an equalProperties(..) method which can be used to compare a value object's properties to that of another instance's.

property.name: generateIsBooleanGetters
property.documentation: When set to 'true' the cartridge will generate an IsAttribute(..) method for each primitive boolean attribute in addition to the normal getAttribute method, or getAttribute for each primitive boolean. Jaxb/Jax-ws defaults everything to primitive boolean for webservice client objects, this is needed for ValueObject method compatibility. Set to false if you don't want additional unused deprecated methods.

property.name: generateChainedSetters
property.documentation: When set to 'true' the setAttribute method returns 'this' instead of void, allowing setter methods to be chained together after the constructor for improved readability and reduced lines of code. For example: Type variable = new Type().setAttribute1(value1).setAttribute2(value2); etc

property.name: XMLDateAdapter
property.documentation: Class which extends Jaxb2 javax.xml.bind.annotation.adapters.XmlAdapter>String, Date<. Handles parse/print of customized String formats. Outputs java.util.Date or java.util.Calendar instead of XMLGregorianCalendar.

property.name: XMLDateTimeAdapter
property.documentation: Class which extends Jaxb2 javax.xml.bind.annotation.adapters.XmlAdapter>String, Date<. Handles parse/print of customized String formats. Outputs java.util.Date or java.util.Calendar instead of XMLGregorianCalendar.

property.name: XMLTimeAdapter
property.documentation: Class which extends Jaxb2 javax.xml.bind.annotation.adapters.XmlAdapter>String, Date<. Handles parse/print of customized String formats. Outputs java.util.Date or java.util.Calendar instead of XMLGregorianCalendar.

property.name: XMLIntegerAdapter
property.documentation: Class which extends Jaxb2 javax.xml.bind.annotation.adapters.XmlAdapter>String, Integer<. Handles parse/print of customized String formats. Outputs Integer instead of BigInteger.

property.name: XMLDecimalAdapter
property.documentation: Class which extends Jaxb2 javax.xml.bind.annotation.adapters.XmlAdapter>String, Decimal<. Handles parse/print of customized String formats. Outputs Decimal instead of BigDecimal.

property.name: XMLBooleanAdapter
property.documentation: Class which extends Jaxb2 javax.xml.bind.annotation.adapters.XmlAdapter>String, Decimal<. Handles parse/print of customized String formats. Outputs Boolean instead of boolean.
